27 January 1959
Dr. Irving R. Merrill
Director of Research, WKAR-TV
Michigan State University
East Lansing, Michigan
Dear Irvj
They didn't waste much time putting the new members of the HAEB research
committee to work I
Here is my view of the four research projects submitted:
KUED, University of Utah: I put this one at the top of my li*t of priorities.
I'm sorry that more exciting hypotheses ar© not being built into this one*
it seems to be a rather routine exercise in a way. But I think it's worth
doing and the sort of thing NAEB should be encouraging. And I think they
have the people to do a job.
Ohio State project in radio history: This would have my top priority if
the outcome were anything but a slide lecture. However I think this is
worth doing in any case. (I'd have suggested a visit to our Mass Communi¬
cations History Center had Sam not made the point} I think some materials
here might be worth poking through.) This one, too, seems to be well staffed.
Ithaca College program evaluation: I do not think this proposal merits sup¬
port as it stands. The proposal itself is very fuzzy about exactly what
they intend to do. The budget seems unrealistic; for example it calls for
at most 100 hours of interviewing each, in what is "naturally" a before-
after study with a "cross-section" of the population. In short I don't
think they know what they're doing.
George Washington University: I see no merit in this proposal whatever.
It doesn't seewi worthy of extended comment.
It's a pleasure to be working with you on this; wish all these little duties
were as painless as this one.
Yours,
Bruce H. Westley
Associate Professor
